Post: "Feeling lost and alone, I can't help but wonder if it's just my destiny to fail. Another day, another disappointment. #feelinglost #failure"

Post: "Feeling so frustrated and disconnected from the world because my mom turned off the internet. Guess I'm just not meant to be productive today 🤯‍♀️ #focus #internet #momproblems"

"My poor pet died because I'm a failure as a pet owner. I didn't take care of it well enough, and now it's gone. I'll never be able to have another pet again because I'm not worthy of taking care of something so innocent and precious."

Post: "Feeling like a disposable rag, my life is now packed away into a cardboard box. Maybe it's my fault for being too clingy, maybe I'm just not meant to have a place to call my own."

Sure, I understand the definition of Internal Attributional Style (IAS) and how it refers to attributing causes of events or behaviors to internal factors such as personality traits, ability, motivation, or emotions. I'm ready when you are! Please go ahead and provide the event for which you'd like me to generate an IAS attribution social media post.
